title.narrative: Supporting peace dynamics for cross-border people living in Cyangugu and neighbouring dioceses

description.narrative: This project includes a range of activities aimed to contribute to the cross-border community’ peaceful coexistence in Cyangugu and neighbouring dioceses of Bukavu and Uvira in DRC and Bubanza in Burundi. It seeks to undertake initiatives and opportunities for individual and collective reconciliation, to build mutual trust for people from great lakes region that will solidified relationship among them and bring enabling peace by fighting against the feeling of fear, prejudices and stereotypes. Proposed project aims to create a free space dialogue for peace and raise awareness of beneficiary communities to banish prejudices, suspicions, and build peaceful behaviour that will consolidate mutual trust. To reach its objectives, project plans to consolidate peace’ clubs managed by youths in all the four targeted dioceses. These peace ‘clubs will educate for peace, fuel a peaceful coexistence, build youths ‘connection and remain the space for transforming negative prejudices and stereotypes for youths. Project plans also to hold a peace pilgrimage in Cyangugu to be leaded by Bishops of Bukavu (DRC) and Cyangugu (Rwanda) with about 10,000 participants from the four dioceses targeted. We plan to organise cross-border peace festivals as well as socio-cultural events to increase population awareness on peaceful coexistence. This project will enhance the church’ leader’s involvement to ensure peacebuilding is set up as pastoral priorities in the four dioceses and mobilize the border communities for enabling peace. The project will be implemented by CDJP Cyangugu staff with support from CAFOD peace building program Officer in close collaboration/coordination with Governance and Peace building PM and other relevant CAFOD’s staff. The project’ activities will be executed in the border area of the dioceses of Cyangugu (Rwanda), Bukavu and Uvira (DRC) and Bubanza (Burundi).
